<span>    </span><span class="token" style="color: rgb(166, 38, 164);">public</span><span> </span><span class="token" style="color: rgb(166, 38, 164);">static</span><span> </span><span class="token return-type" style="color: rgb(166, 38, 164);">float</span><span> </span><span class="token" style="color: rgb(64, 120, 242);">Lerp</span><span class="token" style="color: rgb(56, 58, 66);">(</span><span class="token" style="color: rgb(166, 38, 164);">float</span><span> a</span><span class="token" style="color: rgb(56, 58, 66);">,</span><span> </span><span class="token" style="color: rgb(166, 38, 164);">float</span><span> b</span><span class="token" style="color: rgb(56, 58, 66);">,</span><span> </span><span class="token" style="color: rgb(166, 38, 164);">float</span><span> t</span><span class="token" style="color: rgb(56, 58, 66);">)</span><span class="token" style="color: rgb(56, 58, 66);">;</span><span>
</span><span>    </span><span class="token" style="color: rgb(166, 38, 164);">public</span><span> </span><span class="token" style="color: rgb(166, 38, 164);">static</span><span> </span><span class="token return-type" style="color: rgb(166, 38, 164);">bool</span><span> </span><span class="token" style="color: rgb(64, 120, 242);">IsPowerOfTwo</span><span class="token" style="color: rgb(56, 58, 66);">(</span><span class="token" style="color: rgb(166, 38, 164);">long</span><span> n</span><span class="token" style="color: rgb(56, 58, 66);">)</span><span class="token" style="color: rgb(56, 58, 66);">;</span><span>
</span><span>    </span><span class="token" style="color: rgb(166, 38, 164);">public</span><span> </span><span class="token" style="color: rgb(166, 38, 164);">static</span><span> </span><span class="token return-type" style="color: rgb(166, 38, 164);">double</span><span> </span><span class="token" style="color: rgb(64, 120, 242);">Mod</span><span class="token" style="color: rgb(56, 58, 66);">(</span><span class="token" style="color: rgb(166, 38, 164);">this</span><span> </span><span class="token" style="color: rgb(166, 38, 164);">double</span><span> x</span><span class="token" style="color: rgb(56, 58, 66);">,</span><span> </span><span class="token" style="color: rgb(166, 38, 164);">double</span><span> y</span><span class="token" style="color: rgb(56, 58, 66);">)</span><span class="token" style="color: rgb(56, 58, 66);">;</span><span>
</span><span>    </span><span class="token" style="color: rgb(166, 38, 164);">public</span><span> </span><span class="token" style="color: rgb(166, 38, 164);">static</span><span> </span><span class="token return-type" style="color: rgb(166, 38, 164);">float</span><span> </span><span class="token" style="color: rgb(64, 120, 242);">PrincipalAngle</span><span class="token" style="color: rgb(56, 58, 66);">(</span><span class="token" style="color: rgb(166, 38, 164);">float</span><span> angle</span><span class="token" style="color: rgb(56, 58, 66);">)</span><span class="token" style="color: rgb(56, 58, 66);">;</span><span>
</span><span></span><span class="token" style="color: rgb(56, 58, 66);">}</span></code></pre></div></div></div></div>
<p class="text-foreground leading-relaxed text-base"><strong>Description:</strong> Provides static helper methods for common mathematical operations, with a particular focus on signal processing functions like Fast Fourier Transforms (FFT/IFFT) and windowing functions. These methods leverage SIMD (Single Instruction, Multiple Data) instructions (AVX and SSE) for optimized performance on compatible hardware, with fallbacks to scalar implementations.</p>
<p class="text-foreground leading-relaxed text-base"><strong>Properties:</strong></p>
<ul class="list-disc ml-6 mb-6 space-y-2 text-foreground">
<li class="leading-relaxed"><code class="h-fit font-normal inline-block whitespace-nowrap bg-content2 text-foreground px-1.5 py-0.5 rounded-md font-mono text-sm">EnableAvx</code>: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to use AVX (Advanced Vector Extensions) instructions for operations if the hardware supports them. Defaults to <code class="h-fit font-normal inline-block whitespace-nowrap bg-content2 text-foreground px-1.5 py-0.5 rounded-md font-mono text-sm">true</code>. Setting this to <code class="h-fit font-normal inline-block whitespace-nowrap bg-content2 text-foreground px-1.5 py-0.5 rounded-md font-mono text-sm">false</code> will prevent the use of AVX, forcing a fallback to SSE or scalar code.</li>
<li class="leading-relaxed"><code class="h-fit font-normal inline-block whitespace-nowrap bg-content2 text-foreground px-1.5 py-0.5 rounded-md font-mono text-sm">EnableSse</code>: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to use SSE (Streaming SIMD Extensions) instructions for operations if the hardware supports them. Defaults to <code class="h-fit font-normal inline-block whitespace-nowrap bg-content2 text-foreground px-1.5 py-0.5 rounded-md font-mono text-sm">true</code>. Setting this to <code class="h-fit font-normal inline-block whitespace-nowrap bg-content2 text-foreground px-1.5 py-0.5 rounded-md font-mono text-sm">false</code> will prevent the use of SSE, forcing a fallback to scalar code. This also affects AVX routines that may utilize SSE for specific operations.</li>
</ul>
<p class="text-foreground leading-relaxed text-base"><strong>Methods:</strong></p>
<ul class="list-disc ml-6 mb-6 space-y-2 text-foreground">
<li class="leading-relaxed"><code class="h-fit font-normal inline-block whitespace-nowrap bg-content2 text-foreground px-1.5 py-0.5 rounded-md font-mono text-sm">InverseFft(Complex[] data)</code>: Computes the Inverse Fast Fourier Transform (IFFT) of a complex array. It leverages the <code class="h-fit font-normal inline-block whitespace-nowrap bg-content2 text-foreground px-1.5 py-0.5 rounded-md font-mono text-sm">Fft</code> method internally after conjugating the input and then scales and conjugates the output.</li>
<li class="leading-relaxed"><code class="h-fit font-normal inline-block whitespace-nowrap bg-content2 text-foreground px-1.5 py-0.5 rounded-md font-mono text-sm">Fft(Complex[] data)</code>: Computes the Fast Fourier Transform (FFT) of a complex array. The length of the <code class="h-fit font-normal inline-block whitespace-nowrap bg-content2 text-foreground px-1.5 py-0.5 rounded-md font-mono text-sm">data</code> array must be a power of two. This method automatically selects the most optimized implementation available:</li>
<li class="leading-relaxed">Prioritizes AVX (Advanced Vector Extensions) if <code class="h-fit font-normal inline-block whitespace-nowrap bg-content2 text-foreground px-1.5 py-0.5 rounded-md font-mono text-sm">EnableAvx</code> is <code class="h-fit font-normal inline-block whitespace-nowrap bg-content2 text-foreground px-1.5 py-0.5 rounded-md font-mono text-sm">true</code> and hardware supports it.</li>
<li class="leading-relaxed">Falls back to SSE (Streaming SIMD Extensions) if AVX is not used, <code class="h-fit font-normal inline-block whitespace-nowrap bg-content2 text-foreground px-1.5 py-0.5 rounded-md font-mono text-sm">EnableSse</code> is <code class="h-fit font-normal inline-block whitespace-nowrap bg-content2 text-foreground px-1.5 py-0.5 rounded-md font-mono text-sm">true</code>, and hardware supports SSE3.</li>
<li class="leading-relaxed">Uses a scalar (non-SIMD) implementation if neither AVX nor SSE is available or enabled.</li>
<li class="leading-relaxed"><strong>Throws:</strong> <code class="h-fit font-normal inline-block whitespace-nowrap bg-content2 text-foreground px-1.5 py-0.5 rounded-md font-mono text-sm">ArgumentException</code> if the <code class="h-fit font-normal inline-block whitespace-nowrap bg-content2 text-foreground px-1.5 py-0.5 rounded-md font-mono text-sm">data</code> array length is not a power of two.</li>
<li class="leading-relaxed"><code class="h-fit font-normal inline-block whitespace-nowrap bg-content2 text-foreground px-1.5 py-0.5 rounded-md font-mono text-sm">HammingWindow(int size)</code>: Generates a Hamming window of the specified <code class="h-fit font-normal inline-block whitespace-nowrap bg-content2 text-foreground px-1.5 py-0.5 rounded-md font-mono text-sm">size</code>. Utilizes SIMD (AVX or SSE) acceleration for performance if <code class="h-fit font-normal inline-block whitespace-nowrap bg-content2 text-foreground px-1.5 py-0.5 rounded-md font-mono text-sm">EnableAvx</code> or <code class="h-fit font-normal inline-block whitespace-nowrap bg-content2 text-foreground px-1.5 py-0.5 rounded-md font-mono text-sm">EnableSse</code> is <code class="h-fit font-normal inline-block whitespace-nowrap bg-content2 text-foreground px-1.5 py-0.5 rounded-md font-mono text-sm">true</code> and hardware supports the necessary instructions (SSE4.1 for <code class="h-fit font-normal inline-block whitespace-nowrap bg-content2 text-foreground px-1.5 py-0.5 rounded-md font-mono text-sm">Floor</code> intrinsic), otherwise falls back to a scalar implementation.</li>
<li class="leading-relaxed"><code class="h-fit font-normal inline-block whitespace-nowrap bg-content2 text-foreground px-1.5 py-0.5 rounded-md font-mono text-sm">HanningWindow(int size)</code>: Generates a Hanning window of the specified <code class="h-fit font-normal inline-block whitespace-nowrap bg-content2 text-foreground px-1.5 py-0.5 rounded-md font-mono text-sm">size</code>. Similar to <code class="h-fit font-normal inline-block whitespace-nowrap bg-content2 text-foreground px-1.5 py-0.5 rounded-md font-mono text-sm">HammingWindow</code>, it uses SIMD acceleration (AVX or SSE) if enabled and supported, otherwise falls back to a scalar implementation.</li>
<li class="leading-relaxed"><code class="h-fit font-normal inline-block whitespace-nowrap bg-content2 text-foreground px-1.5 py-0.5 rounded-md font-mono text-sm">Lerp(float a, float b, float t)</code>: Performs linear interpolation between two float values <code class="h-fit font-normal inline-block whitespace-nowrap bg-content2 text-foreground px-1.5 py-0.5 rounded-md font-mono text-sm">a</code> and <code class="h-fit font-normal inline-block whitespace-nowrap bg-content2 text-foreground px-1.5 py-0.5 rounded-md font-mono text-sm">b</code>. The interpolation factor <code class="h-fit font-normal inline-block whitespace-nowrap bg-content2 text-foreground px-1.5 py-0.5 rounded-md font-mono text-sm">t</code> is clamped between 0 and 1, ensuring the result is always between <code class="h-fit font-normal inline-block whitespace-nowrap bg-content2 text-foreground px-1.5 py-0.5 rounded-md font-mono text-sm">a</code> and <code class="h-fit font-normal inline-block whitespace-nowrap bg-content2 text-foreground px-1.5 py-0.5 rounded-md font-mono text-sm">b</code>.</li>
<li class="leading-relaxed"><code class="h-fit font-normal inline-block whitespace-nowrap bg-content2 text-foreground px-1.5 py-0.5 rounded-md font-mono text-sm">IsPowerOfTwo(long n)</code>: Checks if a given long integer <code class="h-fit font-normal inline-block whitespace-nowrap bg-content2 text-foreground px-1.5 py-0.5 rounded-md font-mono text-sm">n</code> is a power of two (e.g., 2, 4, 8, 16, etc.). Returns <code class="h-fit font-normal inline-block whitespace-nowrap bg-content2 text-foreground px-1.5 py-0.5 rounded-md font-mono text-sm">true</code> if <code class="h-fit font-normal inline-block whitespace-nowrap bg-content2 text-foreground px-1.5 py-0.5 rounded-md font-mono text-sm">n</code> is positive and is a power of two, <code class="h-fit font-normal inline-block whitespace-nowrap bg-content2 text-foreground px-1.5 py-0.5 rounded-md font-mono text-sm">false</code> otherwise.</li>
<li class="leading-relaxed"><code class="h-fit font-normal inline-block whitespace-nowrap bg-content2 text-foreground px-1.5 py-0.5 rounded-md font-mono text-sm">Mod(this double x, double y)</code>: An extension method for <code class="h-fit font-normal inline-block whitespace-nowrap bg-content2 text-foreground px-1.5 py-0.5 rounded-md font-mono text-sm">double</code> that returns the remainder of the division of <code class="h-fit font-normal inline-block whitespace-nowrap bg-content2 text-foreground px-1.5 py-0.5 rounded-md font-mono text-sm">x</code> by <code class="h-fit font-normal inline-block whitespace-nowrap bg-content2 text-foreground px-1.5 py-0.5 rounded-md font-mono text-sm">y</code>, ensuring the result is always in the range <code class="h-fit font-normal inline-block whitespace-nowrap bg-content2 text-foreground px-1.5 py-0.5 rounded-md font-mono text-sm">[0, y)</code>. This differs from the standard <code class="h-fit font-normal inline-block whitespace-nowrap bg-content2 text-foreground px-1.5 py-0.5 rounded-md font-mono text-sm">%</code> operator for negative <code class="h-fit font-normal inline-block whitespace-nowrap bg-content2 text-foreground px-1.5 py-0.5 rounded-md font-mono text-sm">x</code>.</li>
<li class="leading-relaxed"><code class="h-fit font-normal inline-block whitespace-nowrap bg-content2 text-foreground px-1.5 py-0.5 rounded-md font-mono text-sm">PrincipalAngle(float angle)</code>: Calculates the principal angle for a given <code class="h-fit font-normal inline-block whitespace-nowrap bg-content2 text-foreground px-1.5 py-0.5 rounded-md font-mono text-sm">angle</code> in radians, ensuring the result lies within the range <code class="h-fit font-normal inline-block whitespace-nowrap bg-content2 text-foreground px-1.5 py-0.5 rounded-md font-mono text-sm">[-PI, PI)</code>.</li>
</ul>

</span><span></span><span class="token" style="color: rgb(56, 58, 66);">}</span></code></pre></div></div></div></div>
<p class="text-foreground leading-relaxed text-base"><strong>Properties:</strong></p>
<ul class="list-disc ml-6 mb-6 space-y-2 text-foreground">
<li class="leading-relaxed"><code class="h-fit font-normal inline-block whitespace-nowrap bg-content2 text-foreground px-1.5 py-0.5 rounded-md font-mono text-sm">Name</code>: The name of the analyzer.</li>
<li class="leading-relaxed"><code class="h-fit font-normal inline-block whitespace-nowrap bg-content2 text-foreground px-1.5 py-0.5 rounded-md font-mono text-sm">Peak</code>: The peak level of the audio signal.</li>
<li class="leading-relaxed"><code class="h-fit font-normal inline-block whitespace-nowrap bg-content2 text-foreground px-1.5 py-0.5 rounded-md font-mono text-sm">Rms</code>: The RMS (root mean square) level of the audio signal.</li>
</ul>
<p class="text-foreground leading-relaxed text-base"><strong>Methods:</strong></p>
<ul class="list-disc ml-6 mb-6 space-y-2 text-foreground">
<li class="leading-relaxed"><code class="h-fit font-normal inline-block whitespace-nowrap bg-content2 text-foreground px-1.5 py-0.5 rounded-md font-mono text-sm">Analyze(Span&lt;float&gt; buffer, int channels)</code>: Analyzes the audio buffer to calculate the RMS and peak levels.</li>
</ul>
<h3 id="visualization-object-object" class="text-2xl font-semibold text-foreground mb-4 mt-8 first:mt-0 scroll-mt-24">Visualization <code class="h-fit font-normal inline-block whitespace-nowrap bg-content2 text-foreground px-1.5 py-0.5 rounded-md font-mono text-sm">LevelMeterVisualizer</code></h3>
<div class="overflow-x-auto mb-6"><div class="group my-8"><div class="aurora-background relative rounded-xl backdrop-blur-sm bg-slate-200 border border-slate-300 shadow-xl shadow-slate-900/15 dark:bg-black/20 dark:border-white/10 dark:shadow-2xl dark:shadow-purple-900/20" style="opacity: 1; transform: none;"><div class="flex items-center justify-between px-4 py-3 rounded-t-xl border-b border-slate-300/70 bg-slate-100/70 dark:border-b-white/5 dark:bg-black/20"><div class="flex items-center gap-4"><span class="text-sm font-medium text-gray-700 dark:text-gray-300">Csharp</span></div><div class="flex items-center gap-2"><button class="flex items-center gap-2 px-3 py-1.5 rounded-md transition-all duration-300 text-gray-600 bg-black/5 hover:bg-blue-500/10 hover:text-blue-700 hover:shadow-lg hover:shadow-blue-500/10 dark:text-gray-300 dark:bg-white/5 dark:hover:bg-purple-500/20 dark:hover:text-white dark:hover:shadow-lg dark:hover:shadow-purple-500/20" aria-label="Copy code"><span style="opacity: 1; </span><span></span><span class="token" style="color: rgb(56, 58, 66);">}</span></code></pre></div></div></div></div>
<p class="text-foreground leading-relaxed text-base"><strong>Properties:</strong></p>
<ul class="list-disc ml-6 mb-6 space-y-2 text-foreground">
<li class="leading-relaxed"><code class="h-fit font-normal inline-block whitespace-nowrap bg-content2 text-foreground px-1.5 py-0.5 rounded-md font-mono text-sm">BarColor</code>: The color of the spectrum bars.</li>
<li class="leading-relaxed"><code class="h-fit font-normal inline-block whitespace-nowrap bg-content2 text-foreground px-1.5 py-0.5 rounded-md font-mono text-sm">Name</code>: The name of the visualizer.</li>
<li class="leading-relaxed"><code class="h-fit font-normal inline-block whitespace-nowrap bg-content2 text-foreground px-1.5 py-0.5 rounded-md font-mono text-sm">Size</code>: The size of the spectrum visualizer.</li>
</ul>
<p class="text-foreground leading-relaxed text-base"><strong>Events:</strong></p>
<ul class="list-disc ml-6 mb-6 space-y-2 text-foreground">
<li class="leading-relaxed"><code class="h-fit font-normal inline-block whitespace-nowrap bg-content2 text-foreground px-1.5 py-0.5 rounded-md font-mono text-sm">VisualizationUpdated</code>: Raised when the visualization needs to be updated.</li>
</ul>
<p class="text-foreground leading-relaxed text-base"><strong>Methods:</strong></p>
<ul class="list-disc ml-6 mb-6 space-y-2 text-foreground">
<li class="leading-relaxed"><code class="h-fit font-normal inline-block whitespace-nowrap bg-content2 text-foreground px-1.5 py-0.5 rounded-md font-mono text-sm">Dispose()</code>: Releases resources used by the visualizer.</li>
<li class="leading-relaxed"><code class="h-fit font-normal inline-block whitespace-nowrap bg-content2 text-foreground px-1.5 py-0.5 rounded-md font-mono text-sm">ProcessOnAudioData(Span&lt;float&gt; audioData)</code>: Processes audio data to update the spectrum.</li>
<li class="leading-relaxed"><code class="h-fit font-normal inline-block whitespace-nowrap bg-content2 text-foreground px-1.5 py-0.5 rounded-md font-mono text-sm">Render(IVisualizationContext context)</code>: Renders the spectrum visualization.</li>
</ul>
